jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #6597: ARROW-7680: [C++] Fix dataset.factory(...) with Windows paths
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6597#discussion_r393590221
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/dataset.py
 ##########
 @@ -252,7 +243,18 @@ def factory(path_or_paths, filesystem=None, partitioning=None,
     elif isinstance(partitioning, Partitioning):
         options.partitioning = partitioning
 
-    return FileSystemDatasetFactory(fs, paths_or_selector, format, options)
+    factories = []
+    for path in path_or_paths:
+        fs, paths_or_selector = _ensure_fs_and_paths(path, filesystem)
+        factories.append(FileSystemDatasetFactory(fs, paths_or_selector,
 
 Review comment:
   Slight downside of this is that if you now create a dataset from a list of file paths, you get a UnionDataset instead of a FileSystemDataset. 
   
   We might need to think about what the preferred API is to create a dataset this way. 
   Doing `ds.FileSystemDataset(..)` is bit hard / low-level. But needing to do `ds.dataset(ds.factory([..]))` as before was also not that nice. 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #6597: ARROW-7680: [C++] Fix dataset.factory(...) with Windows paths
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6597#discussion_r393716103
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/dataset.py
 ##########
 @@ -153,38 +153,27 @@ def partitioning(schema=None, field_names=None, flavor=None):
 
 def _ensure_fs(filesystem, path):
     # Validate or infer the filesystem from the path
-    from pyarrow.fs import FileSystem, LocalFileSystem
+    from pyarrow.fs import FileSystem
 
-    if filesystem is None:
-        try:
-            filesystem, _ = FileSystem.from_uri(path)
-        except Exception:
-            # when path is not found, we fall back to local file system
-            filesystem = LocalFileSystem()
 
 Review comment:
   I suppose those fall back is the reason it worked before

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: [C++][Dataset] Partition discovery is not working with windows path

comments.body: This is probably related to ARROW-7677 (but can keep this open to ensure we remove the skip on the test on partitioning discovery)
Can you try this again to see if this has been fixed?
Since ARROW-7677 is not yet resolved, I assume this will also still fail. But will do a quick try removing the skip.
Indeed, we are still getting the same error (the partition key is not included in the table, because the partitioning is not discovered)
